revision.text:
'''Count Aelianus''' ([[Ancient Greek|Greek]]: Κόμης Αιλιανός; [[Latin]]: Aelianus [[Comes]]) (died 359 AD) was the chief [[Eastern Roman empire#Division of the Roman Empire|Roman]] officer in charge of the defense of [[Amida (Mesopotamia)|Amida]] during the [[Siege of Amida|siege]] of 359 by [[Shah]] [[Shapur II]].<ref name="gbooks">{{cite book | url=https://books.google.com/books?id=vRc8AAAAIAAJ&pg=PA9 | title=The historical work of Ammianus Marcellinus | publisher=Cambridge University Press | year=1947 | accessdate=February 13, 2012 | author=Thompson, E.A. | page=9}}</ref>
Very little is known about his life, except that he was noted by [[Ammianus Marcellinus]] as having led new recruits into an attack on the [[Sassanid Empire|Sassanids]] who were laying [[siege]] to the Roman city of [[Singara]].<ref>{{cite book|last=Ammianus Marcellinus|title=Res Gestae|year=1982|publisher=Harvard University Press|location=Cambridge, MA|pages=18.9.3}}</ref> After the capture and [[Looting|sack]] of Amida, he was [[gibbet]]ed by the victorious Sassanians along with his [[Tribune#Cohort commander|tribunes]].<ref>{{cite book|last=Ammianus Marcellinus|title=Res Gestae|year=1982|publisher=Harvard University Press|location=Cambridge MA|pages=19.9.2}}</ref>
He was mentioned in the earlier books of Ammianus Marcellinus (books 1-13), but these are lost.<ref>{{cite book|last=Matthews|first=John F.|title=The Roman Empire of Ammianus|year=1988|publisher=Gerald Duckworth & Co. Ltd|location=London|pages=6}}</ref>
